articles.title: ‘It is an employer’s market’: Tech layoffs may have turned the Great Resignation into the Great Recommitment
articles.content: The flood of recently laid-off tech workers on the job market has upended the dynamic between employers and employees, leading to prolonged job searches.

articles.title: Is Apple Stock Headed To $250? Why Gene Munster Says 'One Of The World's Greatest Companies' Is Poised To Double
articles.content:
Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) was the last to feel the effects of the tech wreck. The stock fell out of the $2 trillion club to start the year, but one analyst saw a resurgence on the horizon.
"This should be a $250 stock," Loup Funds' Gene Munster said Wednesday (Jan. 4) on CNBC's "Squawk Box."
What To Know: Apple acted as a safe haven for mega-cap tech investors for much of 2022, but the seemingly relentless market trend lower eventually swept the stock from its post. 
Munster believed the near-term direction of Apple hinged on a combination of its December quarter results and March quarter guidance. Given Tesla Inc's (NASDAQ: TSLA) miss on deliveries to start the year, it made sense that investors were concerned, Munster said.
"Companies that have been beating and exceeding are now ...Full story available on Benzinga.com
